title: Print, "Fountain Maker's Costume from "Costumes of Trades and Professions"", ca. 1690
inscribed: below image:  Habit de Fontainier,/A Paris, Chez N. de Lármessin, Rüe St. Jacq, á [sic] la Póme d'Or.   Avec, Privil. du Roy.
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment and through gift of Mrs. Edward C. Post
description: Man dressed as a fountain with jet and tier for hat, torso clad in two basins adorned with tritons, and supporting statues for legs.  Man holds tools in both hands.  Costumed man stands on garden terrace.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Fountain Maker's Costume from "Costumes of Trades and Professions"", ca. 1690.
ca. 1690. Engraving on paper. Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment and through gift of Mrs. Edward C. Post. 1995-47-2.
